result.execSummary:
The defendant Demonn S Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Contrary to Injunction, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge  are to be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 8/28/17.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program.
Successfully complete a parenting program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demonn S Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to vacate one DNA surcharge.  Original filed in 13CF003788.
Original Transcript (63 pages) commencing 08/28/2014 PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Demonn S Williams in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Defendant Demonn S Williams in custody.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 4:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNTS 5 and 6:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Counts 5 and 6 DISMISSED and READ IN.
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by:
 Toilyn P.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 152 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8/28/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8/28/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Bridget J. Krause in court, defendant Demonn S Williams not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ sab
Court is currently in trial. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 8/28/2014 at 8:30 am.

Attorney Bridget J Krause in court, defendant Demonn S Williams not in court, in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant has a pending case in Br. 15.  Judge Watts has accepted this case for a global resolution and Attorney Krause moves to have case transferred.  Court allows case to be transferred to Br. 15 subject to Judge Watts accepting the case.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Steven Sargent for Bridget J Krause in court, defendant Demonn S Williams not in court, in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received discovery.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bridget J Krause in court, defendant Demonn S Williams not in court, in custody.  William Levins for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant has a pending case in Br. 15 with similar charges.  Attorney Krause needs to speak with the State regarding a possible global resolution.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demonn S Williams in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Defendant Demonn S Williams in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay for Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
Defendant is to monitored by drug testing.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Demonn S Williams in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Demonn S Williams in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pleads not guilty to COUNT 6. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
